comment: Mr. Beecken is not a professor. He has field experience in accounting but has no business teaching students, especially in such a lower level accounting class. His lectures are the most monotone boring things you'll ever sit through. He usually forgets what he's saying mid sentence. Save yourself and do not take a class with him.

I think he's a great person and really wanted us to do well. He tried, but it was just hard. The lectures were very basic, long and didn't really make sense making it very hard to pay attention. I basically taught myself. I don't think he is teaching this class again, though. Which is good because it's not his strong suit. He is very nice, though!

Not my favorite professor, but not too hard either. He seems to go on and on with same topic, but makes it more confusing along the way. I had to do a lot of studying, because listening to him just confused me. If you have another option I would take someone else, but If you have no choice he's not that bad. Just put in the effort.

Not always clear with his assignments. Everything is online and the system messes up almost every time you use it. Beecken is okay. He's not extremely helpful or knowledgeable. He uses a point grading policy and points are taken off for missing class.
One of SPSU better teachers. He should be teaching both Accounting classes. He is a very helpful teacher who is willing to teach and Not be about himself like the witch Conn.

New teacher, not sure if he will be back (more than likely).  Very knowledge is the field of accounting, seems like explaining this subject is elementary to him.  Tells lots of real life examples.  Takes attendance every day.  Overall, pretty good.  Do the work, study for the tests, and you will get a B or A
